The number of confirmed COVID-19 cases in West Sussex so far as at 23 July is 54,284 (6,283 cases per 100,000 population). In the seven days to 18 July, there were 4,316 new confirmed cases (499.5 new cases per 100,000). In the seven days to 11 July, there were 2,534 new cases and so the new cases have risen by 70% (1,782 extra cases).
